resources.string: Sign In to Sync Your Preferences Across Devices
For further information on the facilities and services available pleas email us on
Cardiff School of Technologies offers accredited, practically led degrees in Engineering, Computer Science, and Creative Technologies.

We work closely with employers across the tech industry to carefully design courses that are industry-relevant, and career focused, offering you opportunities to gain work experience, continue your research, or sstudy with our international partners.
Access industry-standard equipment and labs, exclusive student spaces, VR booths, gaming consoles and more.

With dedicated student coach mentors, the school fosters a supportive, close-knit community. At Cardiff School of Technologies, we know you by name, and when you study with us, you become part of our community.

The University has a variety of lecture theatres and seminar rooms available for hire. Whether you\'re arranging a meeting for a small number of people or arranging a large conference we can accommodate your needs. All our rooms have full audio visual equipment built in and Wifi is available on site.
For any further information or requests speak to one of our colleagues
Cardiff Met University offers Open Days for undergraduate students which is a perfect chance for you to find out more about the courses you\'re interested in.

This will give you an opportunity to speak to some of the course tutors and students, tour of the facilities, accommodation and campus. This will also give you the opportunity to visit Cardiff and explore the beautiful city.

All visitors to Cardiff Met campuses are required to Pay and Display at the signed rate. In addition, visitors to the Llandaff Campus between 08.00am and 4.00pm must report to Reception to collect a temporary parking permit to be displayed alongside their Pay and Display ticket. Visitor Parking Spaces at Llandaff are severely limited and there is no guarantee of availability of a parking space. For large events, please discuss parking with the organisers in advance of your visit.
Llandaff campus is the home of the Cardiff School of Sports and Health Sciences, School of Management, Cardiff School of Technologies and the Cardiff School of Art and Design.
We are pleased to confirm that 12 x EV chargers (22Kwh) are now available on this campus for staff, students and visitors (charges apply)
• From Cardiff City Centre: 62, 63, 66 from Westgate Street, stopping at Western Avenue (3min walk)
• From Cyncoed Campus: M1* stopping at Cardiff Met Llandaff Campus
For timetables and full route details visit the Cardiff Bus website
Waun-Gron railway station is approximately 20 minutes walk away from the Llandaff campus, and is on the City Line. See the National Rail Enquiries for train times.

Cardiff benefits from a network of cycle routes, including many traffic-free cycle paths. The Llandaff campus is situated right next to the Taff Trail, a popular national cycle route leading from the city centre as far north as Merthyr Tydfil.

There is also a traffic-free bicycle path connecting the Llandaff campus with the Plas Gwyn residential campus, with only a short on-road section between Plas Gwyn and the cycle path entrance on Bridge Road. As this cycle path is currently not lit, we would advise you take an alternative route when travelling late at night.

Deciding where to study isn\'t just about finding the right course. It’s about choosing where you’ll feel at home and the opportunities that will help you thrive and grow at university. Whether it’s the social life, extra-curricular activities or support to help you reach your potential, you’ll find it all at Cardiff Met. Find out more about life at Cardiff Met from students.
